metadata.title: Tokyo's Climate Change Officials to Continue Promoting Sectoral Approach(2008)

overview: Japanese climate change officials remain committed to the 'sectoral approach' despite the International Energy Agency and EU criticisms documented in this top-secret NSA report from 2008. The approach is presented as a strategic move to incorporate major economies like China, India, and the U.S. into carbon emission reduction efforts.

methodology.description: Derived from intelligence intercepts of Japanese officials.
documents_reviewed: Intelligence intercepts of officials within the Japanese government

background.context: Japanese officials are promoting the 'sectoral approach' to carbon emission reductions amidst international criticism, aiming to include major global economies in collaborative efforts.
entities_involved: Ministry of Economy Trade and Industry (METI)
timeline: 2008-05-15;2008-05-31: Fatih Birol of the IEA issues warnings about the sectoral approach
2008: Masakazu Toyoda discusses sectoral approach advantages

key_findings: Japanese officials continue promoting the sectoral approach despite criticism.
Fatih Birol warned Japan about potential misinterpretations of their efforts.
Masakazu Toyoda outlined strategic benefits of the approach.
risks: Potential economic threats from Japanese businesses abandoning Europe if the Emissions Trading Scheme (ETS) continues unchanged.
